data.name: Polynomial coefficients
data.description: Description: Find the polynomial coefficients which have the given roots. Theory: Every polynomial can be express by a multiplication of binomial like that: p(x) = K * (x - r0)(x - r1)(x - r2)...(x - rn) In our case, to simpify a little bit, K will always be equal to unity. If we multiply every binomial together, we will get the following form: p(x) = xn + c1 \* xn-1 + c2 \* xn-2 + ... + cn-1 \* x1 + cn We can now express the coefficients vector with: c = [ c1, c2, ..., cn-1, cn ] where each ci is the coefficient in front of the power of x. We will use for convention that the coefficient must appear in DECREASING power of x (see next example) Example p(x) = (x - 1)(x - 2)(x - 3)(x - 4) roots = [1, 2, 3, 4] To start, we can multiply the 2 first binomial: p1(x) = (x - 1)(x - 2) = x2 -3x + 2 We can now multiply the 3rd binomial with p1(x): p2(x) = (x2-3x + 2)(x - 3) = x3 - 6x2 + 11x - 6 Finally, we multiply the last binomial with p2(x): p3(x) = (x3 - 6x2 + 11x - 6)(x - 4) = x4 - 10x3 + 35x2 -50x + 24 The final coefficients are: [1 -10 35 -50 24] polyCoeffs([1, 2, 3, 4]) c = [1 -10 35 -50 24] Parameters Input: roots: A list of roots in the form: [r0, r1, r2, ..., rn] Output: c: A list with the polynomial coefficients in descending order with respect to the exponent power (Refer to example section to see the formating)
